content: marled hat | by plucky knitter a hat recipe for playing with color and texture choose two of your favorite plucky worsted bases knit them held together on large needles and the result is a thick cushy marled fabric suitable for the entire family this recipe can be easily adjusted by choosing varied bases and needle sizes or casting on more or less stitches keep those noggins warm yarn gauge plucky knitter cachet 100% cashmere 180 yds / 165 m per 105 g 16 sts and 20 row over 4 / 10 cm in stockinette stitch in colorway pup tent 1 skein plucky knitter snug worsted 70% merino 20% cashmere 10% alpaca 230 yds / 210 m size per 115 g in colorway mortica 1 skein 19 / 48 5 cm circumference x 9 height materials size us 10 6 mm 16 / 40 cm circular circ needle and set of double pointed needles dpns or size necessary to obtain gauge size us 7 4 5 mm 16 / 40 cm circ needle stitch marker tapestry needle optional alpaca fur pom pom note alpaca fur pom poms are sold at thetoftalpacashop co uk directions abbreviations using smaller needles and 2 strands of yarn held together co 76 sts pm and join in the round being careful not to twist the sts co cast on round 1 *k1 tbl p1 repeat from * around k knit repeat last round until piece measures 2 / 5 cm from co edge m1 insert lh needle under horizon- body set-up tal strand between st just worked and increase round *k4 m1 k1 repeat from * to last 6 sts k6 90 sts next st from the front to the back knit through the back loop body change to larger needle p purl work even in st st until hat measures 9 / 23 cm from cast on edge pm place marker finishing cut yarn leaving an approx 30 / 76 cm tail using tapestry needle thread repeat repeat tail through all sts in a circular manner and cinch closed fasten_off yarn and weave in loose ends block round s round s also shown in… st st stockinette stitch knit every round twill version scholar 2 0 and scholar -
